pr_title: [RW-4825][risk=no] Misc. tweaks & small refactors split from main story branch

timeline.message: add a new kitchen sink type

timeline.bodyText: By injecting this random value, we no longer have to use a spy() around the DataSetService.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: This is actually leftover from the other (future) branch. I can remove from this PR if necessary, but it's pretty small.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: Should send DbUser from here? Whats the convention for Optional objects from DB, service will handle ifPresent or controller?
replies.author: NehaBroad

replies.bodyText: Yes, or you can use .orElseThrow(() -> new NotFoundException())
replies.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: Public static methods on used classes are fair game for the mapper.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: FWIW, I'm not sure "common" is much of an abstraction. I kinda feel like breaking this down further so the uses directives are more granular.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: One could argue for merging this with the ProfileMapper...
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: This class's only advantage is its no-arg constructor. It's used in a tool Spring configuration below.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: Lots of heavy services were initialized inline in the @Before method, greatly inflating the number of test class members.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: One could argue for a new DatasetConfig to host this. I don't have strong feelings at the moment.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: yeah this should be in dataSetConfig code. And just for curiosity whats the argument for this being here?
replies.author: NehaBroad

replies.bodyText:
Just saw this.
DatasetConfig does not yet exist, but I reckon I can conjure it into being...
replies.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: Using the @MockBean annotation directly on the members is cleaner than putting it here and using @Autowire. I keep this list around for those mocks that don't need to have named instances.
timeline.author: jaycarlton
NehaBroad

replies.bodyText: it's a dataset identifier that's usually random. The test was previously spying on the (real) controller and overriding the value with all zeroes as if it were a mock.
replies.author: jaycarlton

timeline.author: NehaBroad

timeline.bodyText: Question: Why did you use new ArrayList here?
timeline.author: NehaBroad

replies.bodyText: Updated to use Collections.emptyList() everywhere in this test.
replies.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: Why did you decide to send null rather than Empty Object?
timeline.author: NehaBroad

replies.bodyText: Oh i see because it was used as new WorkspaceService(null,null...)
replies.author: NehaBroad

replies.bodyText: This is just default codegen in IntelliJ. These should never be called.
replies.author: jaycarlton
